alert.note: Alert for Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 9:35AM MST until February 21 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 4 inches valleys and 5 to 10 inches in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Chewelah, Springdale-Hunters Road, Tiger, Eastport, Bonners Ferry, Colville, Athol, Orin-Rice Road, Fruitland, Metaline Falls, Flowery Trail Road, Priest River, Kettle Falls, Metaline, Deer Park, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Clark Fork, Sandpoint, Ione, Newport, and Northport. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Untreated roads will likely become very slick by early Tuesday evening as temperatures quickly drop. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tuesday morning accumulations are possible mainly around Metaline Falls and the North Idaho Panhandle. The majority of the accumulations are expected Tuesday afternoon into the evening. Flash freeze conditions may occur with dropping temperatures and snowfall on cold roads.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
